update.description:
This is a port of the [Wind Plugin from Gazebo classic](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/676a14f7642c3516e6a779ac276e8898cd7d0f79/plugins/WindPlugin.cc?at=default). Notable changes are:

  * `forceApproximationScalingFactor` is initialized to 1.0 instead of 0.
  * `directionMean` is initialized with the first value of `direction`. This is to avoid the filter always ramping up from zero.
  * `Wind::WindPrivate::linearVel` in Gazebo classic is now represented by the `WorldLinearVelocitySeed` component on the Wind entity
  * The component `WorldLinearVelocity` on the Wind entity is analogous to the result of `Wind::WorldLinearVel()` in Gazebo classic

## Dependencies

* ign-gazebo PR #256
* ign-gazebo PR #269 (This is merged in this branch for expediency)

## Example:
```
ign-gazebo -v 4 -f examples/worlds/wind.sdf
```

To change the velocity seed:

```
ign topic -t "/world/wind_demo/wind/" -m ignition.msgs.Wind  -p "linear_velocity: {x:-50, y:50}, enable_wind: true"
```
update.title: [Acropolis] Port Wind plugin

content.raw: Tests are passing. I'm merging this.
content.html: Tests are passing. I'm merging this.

content.raw: It turns out clang-tidy only complains about this for constructors, so I changed it to `const &` in 5919397
content.html: It turns out clang-tidy only complains about this for constructors, so I changed it to const & in 5919397

content.raw:
The original [PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/174/acropolis-add-contact-sensor/diff#chg-src/systems/contact/Contact.cc) has them being passed by value. Not sure where/when they were changed to `const &`. 

> Wouldn't using const & and removing the std::move result in the same number of copies as passing by non-const value and then moving?

I think clang-tidy recommends passing by copy followed by a move because it avoids an extra construction if the passed in value is already an rvalue. Won't make much of a difference here because `Load` is only called once. I'm okay either way.
content.html:
The original PR has them being passed by value. Not sure where/when they were changed to const &.

Wouldn't using const & and removing the std::move result in the same number of copies as passing by non-const value and then moving?

I think clang-tidy recommends passing by copy followed by a move because it avoids an extra construction if the passed in value is already an rvalue. Won't make much of a difference here because Load is only called once. I'm okay either way.

content.raw:
Oh interesting , it's because it's being moved below. This is the warning on default, which is using `const &`:

~~~
/home/developer/ws/src/ign-gazebo/src/systems/contact/Contact.cc:115:19: warning: std::move of the const variable '_topic' has no effect; remove std::move() or make the variable non-const [performance-move-const-arg]
    this->topic = std::move(_topic);
                  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~

Wouldn't using `const &` and removing the `std::move` result in the same number of copies as passing by non-const value and then moving?
content.html:
Oh interesting , it's because it's being moved below. This is the warning on default, which is using const &:

/home/developer/ws/src/ign-gazebo/src/systems/contact/Contact.cc:115:19: warning: std::move of the const variable '_topic' has no effect; remove std::move() or make the variable non-const [performance-move-const-arg]
    this->topic = std::move(_topic);
                  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Wouldn't using const & and removing the std::move result in the same number of copies as passing by non-const value and then moving?

content.raw: I'm investigating the Homebrew failures.
content.html: I'm investigating the Homebrew failures.

content.raw: I believe clang-tidy recommends not doing `const &` when the parameter is going to be copied to a member.
content.html: I believe clang-tidy recommends not doing const & when the parameter is going to be copied to a member.

content.raw: Ahh, that's my bad. I had thought SDF contained all of the necessary parameters for wind. Thanks.
content.html: Ahh, that's my bad. I had thought SDF contained all of the necessary parameters for wind. Thanks.

content.raw: This here is the plugin's custom configuration so I don't know how we can avoid using `sdf::Element`. For the global wind velocity setting, I am using the World DOM. The Link DOM currently doesn't have `enable_wind` so I ended up using `sdf::Element` [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/273/acropolis-port-wind-plugin/diff#Lsrc/SdfEntityCreator.ccT248). I was planning to create a a follow PR to remove that.
content.html: This here is the plugin's custom configuration so I don't know how we can avoid using sdf::Element. For the global wind velocity setting, I am using the World DOM. The Link DOM currently doesn't have enable_wind so I ended up using sdf::Element here. I was planning to create a a follow PR to remove that.

content.raw:
SDF DOM contains wind information (https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/eb25f39cfa81ea7d4b0e61cb60de6bb72c64f8f9/include/sdf/World.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#World.hh-86). Would it be better if that information was in a separate DOM object in sdf, instead of bundled in the `World` object?

The reason I'm asking is to hopefully remove the `sdf::Element` pointer from our gazebo code, and rely solely on the DOM.
content.html:
SDF DOM contains wind information (https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/eb25f39cfa81ea7d4b0e61cb60de6bb72c64f8f9/include/sdf/World.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#World.hh-86). Would it be better if that information was in a separate DOM object in sdf, instead of bundled in the World object?

The reason I'm asking is to hopefully remove the sdf::Element pointer from our gazebo code, and rely solely on the DOM.

  * `forceApproximationScalingFactor` is initialized to 1.0 instead of 0.
  * `directionMean` is initialized with the first value of `direction`. This is to avoid the filter always ramping up from zero.
  * `Wind::WindPrivate::linearVel` in Gazebo classic is now represented by the `WorldLinearVelocitySeed` component on the Wind entity
  * The component `WorldLinearVelocity` on the Wind entity is analogous to the result of `Wind::WorldLinearVel()` in Gazebo classic

## Dependencies

* ign-gazebo PR #256
* ign-gazebo PR #269 (This is merged in this branch for expediency)

## Example:
```
ign-gazebo -v 4 -f examples/worlds/wind.sdf
```

To change the velocity seed:

```
ign topic -t "/world/wind_demo/wind/" -m ignition.msgs.Wind  -p "linear_velocity: {x:-50, y:50}, enable_wind: true"
```
update.title: [Acropolis] Port Wind plugin
